    • README

    My Starred Repositories

    With my repository Pentest-tools the idea was to use this as an alternative search for useful repositories, as the stars section has limited filter capabilities on Github. The additional information of the description is really helpfull here, so that's why I created ths original repo. It's possible there to just search for content via STRG + F and find more than with the default filter settings. Doing the categorzation however was lot of efford manually.

    This is on the other hand side way faster and automated:

    import requests

github_username = "<username>"  # Replace with your GitHub username

def get_starred_repos(username):
    starred_repos = []
    page = 1
    per_page = 100
    
    while True:
        url = f"https://api.github.com/users/{username}/starred?per_page={per_page}&page={page}"
        try:
            response = requests.get(url) 
            if response.status_code == 403:
                print("API rate limit exceeded. Stopping further requests.")
                break
            if response.status_code != 200:
                print(f"Error fetching starred repositories. Status code: {response.status_code}")
                print(f"Response content: {response.content}")
                break
            
            data = response.json()
            if not data:
                break
            
            for repo in data:
                starred_repos.append({
                    "name": repo["name"],
                    "url": repo["html_url"],
                    "description": repo.get("description", "No description provided.")
                })
            
            page += 1
        except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
            print(f"Request failed: {e}")
            break
    
    return starred_repos

def save_readme(starred_repos):
    readme_content = "# My Starred Repositories\n\n"
    for repo in starred_repos:
        readme_content += f"- [{repo['name']}]({repo['url']}): {repo['description']}\n"
    
    with open("README.md", "w", encoding="utf-8") as f:
        f.write(readme_content)
    print("README.md has been created in the current working directory.")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    starred_repos = get_starred_repos(github_username)
    if starred_repos:
        save_readme(starred_repos)

    With authentication it can be extended to also e.G. filter by language, add the repo README content up to line x or whatever. But for now and 5 minutes effort I'm happy with this :-)

    • Inveigh: .NET IPv4/IPv6 machine-in-the-middle tool for penetration testers
    • trufflehog: Find, verify, and analyze leaked credentials
    • Sublist3r: Fast subdomains enumeration tool for penetration testers
    • dirtycow.github.io: Dirty COW
    • inception: Inception is a physical memory manipulation and hacking tool exploiting PCI-based DMA. The tool can attack over FireWire, Thunderbolt, ExpressCard, PC Card and any other PCI/PCIe interfaces.
    • movfuscator: The single instruction C compiler
    • Quasar: Remote Administration Tool for Windows
    • Kautilya: Kautilya - Tool for easy use of Human Interface Devices for offensive security and penetration testing.
    • gateway-finder: Tool to identify routers on the local LAN and paths to the Internet
    • powerstager: A payload stager using PowerShell
    • eaphammer: Targeted evil twin attacks against WPA2-Enterprise networks. Indirect wireless pivots using hostile portal attacks.
    • morpheus: Morpheus - Automating Ettercap TCP/IP (MITM-hijacking Tool)
    • net-creds: Sniffs sensitive data from interface or pcap
    • unicorn: Unicorn is a simple tool for using a PowerShell downgrade attack and inject shellcode straight into memory. Based on Matthew Graeber's powershell attacks and the powershell bypass technique presented by David Kennedy (TrustedSec) and Josh Kelly at Defcon 18.
    • WMImplant: This is a PowerShell based tool that is designed to act like a RAT. Its interface is that of a shell where any command that is supported is translated into a WMI-equivalent for use on a network/remote machine. WMImplant is WMI based.
    • Sherlock: PowerShell script to quickly find missing software patches for local privilege escalation vulnerabilities.
    • vuls: Agent-less vulnerability scanner for Linux, FreeBSD, Container, WordPress, Programming language libraries, Network devices
    • PoshC2_Old: Powershell C2 Server and Implants
    • BeRoot: Privilege Escalation Project - Windows / Linux / Mac
    • PowerMeta: PowerMeta searches for publicly available files hosted on various websites for a particular domain by using specially crafted Google, and Bing searches. It then allows for the download of those files from the target domain. After retrieving the files, the metadata associated with them can be analyzed by PowerMeta. Some interesting things commonly found in metadata are usernames, domains, software titles, and computer names.
    • evilginx: PLEASE USE NEW VERSION: https://github.com/kgretzky/evilginx2
    • lynis: Lynis - Security auditing tool for Linux, macOS, and UNIX-based systems. Assists with compliance testing (HIPAA/ISO27001/PCI DSS) and system hardening. Agentless, and installation optional.
    • wpscan: WPScan WordPress security scanner. Written for security professionals and blog maintainers to test the security of their WordPress websites. Contact us via contact@wpscan.com
    • mimipy: port of mimipenguin.sh in python with some additional protection features
    • mimipenguin: A tool to dump the login password from the current linux user
    • scapy: Scapy: the Python-based interactive packet manipulation program & library.
    • gobuster: Directory/File, DNS and VHost busting tool written in Go
    • pupy: Pupy is an opensource, cross-platform (Windows, Linux, OSX, Android) C2 and post-exploitation framework written in python and C
    • Sn1per: Attack Surface Management Platform
    • CrackMapExec: A swiss army knife for pentesting networks
    • shadowbroker: The Shadow Brokers "Lost In Translation" leak
    • Probable-Wordlists: Version 2 is live! Wordlists sorted by probability originally created for password generation and testing - make sure your passwords aren't popular!
    • EyeWitness: EyeWitness is designed to take screenshots of websites, provide some server header info, and identify default credentials if possible.
    • LaZagne: Credentials recovery project
    • CheatSheets: Cheat sheets for various projects.
    • awesome-windows-domain-hardening: A curated list of awesome Security Hardening techniques for Windows.
    • doublepulsar-detection-script: A python2 script for sweeping a network to find windows systems compromised with the DOUBLEPULSAR implant.
    • PowerForensics: PowerForensics provides an all in one platform for live disk forensic analysis
    • PowerShellArsenal: A PowerShell Module Dedicated to Reverse Engineering
    • poisontap: Exploits locked/password protected computers over USB, drops persistent WebSocket-based backdoor, exposes internal router, and siphons cookies using Raspberry Pi Zero & Node.js.
    • Awesome-Hacking: A collection of various awesome lists for hackers, pentesters and security researchers
    • PowerMemory: Exploit the credentials present in files and memory
    • warberry: WarBerryPi - Tactical Exploitation
    • WiFi-Pumpkin-deprecated: DEPRECATED, wifipumpkin3 -> https://github.com/P0cL4bs/wifipumpkin3
    • PowerSploit: PowerSploit - A PowerShell Post-Exploitation Framework
    • nishang: Nishang - Offensive PowerShell for red team, penetration testing and offensive security.
    • SessionGopher: SessionGopher is a PowerShell tool that uses WMI to extract saved session information for remote access tools such as WinSCP, PuTTY, SuperPuTTY, FileZilla, and Microsoft Remote Desktop. It can be run remotely or locally.
    • DomainPasswordSpray: DomainPasswordSpray is a tool written in PowerShell to perform a password spray attack against users of a domain. By default it will automatically generate the userlist from the domain. BE VERY CAREFUL NOT TO LOCKOUT ACCOUNTS!
    • tricky.lnk: Creates a .lnk file with unicode chars that reverse the file extension and adds a .txt to the end to make it appear as a textfile. Payload is a powershell webdl and execute
    • sticky_keys_hunter: A script to test an RDP host for sticky keys and utilman backdoor.
    • TheFatRat: Thefatrat a massive exploiting tool : Easy tool to generate backdoor and easy tool to post exploitation attack like browser attack and etc . This tool compiles a malware with popular payload and then the compiled malware can be execute on windows, android, mac . The malware that created with this tool also have an ability to bypass most AV software protection .
    • autopwn: Specify targets and run sets of tools against them
    • Winpayloads: Undetectable Windows Payload Generation
    • routersploit: Exploitation Framework for Embedded Devices
    • wifiphisher: The Rogue Access Point Framework
    • Responder: Responder is a LLMNR, NBT-NS and MDNS poisoner, with built-in HTTP/SMB/MSSQL/FTP/LDAP rogue authentication server supporting NTLMv1/NTLMv2/LMv2, Extended Security NTLMSSP and Basic HTTP authentication.
    • mimikittenz: A post-exploitation powershell tool for extracting juicy info from memory.
    • awesome-pentest: A collection of awesome penetration testing resources, tools and other shiny things
    • MailSniper: MailSniper is a penetration testing tool for searching through email in a Microsoft Exchange environment for specific terms (passwords, insider intel, network architecture information, etc.). It can be used as a non-administrative user to search their own email, or by an administrator to search the mailboxes of every user in a domain.
